profile_positions.description:
07/11/2018 - 30/09/2020  (remote after 14/09/2020)
Program Manager role: improving the quality of programming-related courses (review and improve the content and way of teaching), encouraging cross-discipline collaboration and sharing of good practices, defining procedures, deciding on and managing internal tools (Zoom, GitLab..), being part of the advisory team managing the general activities and priorities of Wantsome academy.

Trainer role: defining the content and then ongoing teaching of 2 courses: Java Fundamentals, Introduction to Programming. They are beginner level courses, focused on the practical side, aimed at developing logical thinking (algorithms, problem solving abilities, debugging) as well as teaching some fundamental technologies (Java, SQL, web-related concepts, Python, Scratch) and usage of common programmer tools (Git, GitLab, IntelliJ IDEA, MySQL). 

For the Java course I've also built internal tools to stream-line the learning process for my students - like having detailed home assignments covering all important class topics, with a comprehensible suite of unit tests to check correctness, an an auto-grader solution giving them immediate feedback and computing the final score (which I later manually adjusted a little, when reviewer each assignment, but in general was spot-on).  Based on: GitLab, IntelliJ IDE, Gradle (with a customized runner+annotations), bash scripts.
I've also researched and integrated in the Java course some beginner friendly tools: SQLite (for DB intro part), Spark web microframework and later Javalin web framework, with Velocity templates (for web intro part).

profile_positions.description:
04/06/2018 - 24/05/2019
Experience: 
   - main: Scala (2.12), SBT, Akka Http, ElasticSearch, Kafka, Avro 
   - to a lesser degree: Spark (DataBricks cloud, jobs written in Scala)
   - tools: Docker, Marathon, Consul, Graphana, Kibana, Prometheus, AWS, S3, Linux

I worked on back-end services for the online platform of a customer in the fashion/retail industry (a Dutch-based company)

I was part of the product search team - a small, distributed team. 
We developed, tested and supported our code in production (no separate tester roles). 
We managed a few micro-services, written in Scala, which served the product search functionality:
- services which consumed data from Kafka topics (json/avro format), transformed and inserted it in a few Elasticsearch indexes
- services which translated queries from web/front-end layer to efficient ElasticSearch queries, executed them (multiple phases, some parallel), parsed and returned the results (rest web services, json format)
I also managed (monitoring, upgrading) the ES cluster, as well as contributing to a few internal libraries (used in common by other Scala services).

Overall, what I enjoyed most was the opportunity to improve and apply my understanding of functional programming paradigm (using Scala) to production ready systems, and learning from my more experienced colleagues, as well as working in an international team.

volunteer_experiences.description:
I took part in the bi-monthly workshops, organized at the location offered by my employer at the time.
We worked on implementing locally the ideas of the Coder Dojo global organization: offering code learning opportunities for children of various ages (7 to 18 years), starting with simple visual games and visual block programming, Scratch (for younger children) up to coding in various programming languages like C++, Java, Python, Javascript (for older children). 

I had a mentor role, sharing my knowledge to help them advance in their exercises/projects. All mentors were volunteers, and each was assigned to a small group of 5-7 children, having in total up to 30 children per workshop. I worked with older children too, but I especially enjoyed helping the younger ones to advance their logical and coding abilities.

More info: https://www.facebook.com/CoderDojoOptymyze , https://www.coderdojo.ro/

Helping with administrative tasks related to the current activities at the center location, but also on outgoing events.

Short description of the center:
The „Nicolae Milescu” Chinese Cultural Center, Iasi, is an initiative of Youth With a Mission, Iasi. Its main objective is to create a space for intercultural dialogue between Romania and China, by organizing cultural events, educational projects and exchange programs. And, last but not least, to offer a welcoming place to all those who are interested in finding out more about the beauty and uniqueness of the Chinese culture, and where „upon arrival, each guest feels as if he’s come back home” (Chinese proverb).

More info:
https://www.facebook.com/centerofchineseculture
